title._content: Rabbi Albert Minda of Temple Israel

tag.raw: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest
tag.author: 48143042@N05

description._content: Rabbi Minda succeeded Rabbi Amos Deinard at Temple Israel after Deinard's death in 1921. Minda was a graduate of Hebrew Union Collage, and served Temple Israel until his retirement in 1963. Minda was an exceptional leader, presiding over the construction of a new synagogue in 1929, the founding of the Minneapolis Jewish Federation in 1949, the Minneapolis Urban League and The Minneapolis Roundtable of Christians and Jews. In Minnesota's Centennial year--1949--he was designated as one of the "Hundred Living Great [sic] of Minnesota." Date: 1937 Source: 20.5 cm x 14.2 cm Format: Black and White original photo Subject: Famous Minnesotans; Portraits; Minda, Rabbi Albert Coverage: Minneapolis; Hennepin; Minnesota; United States Local Identifier: P-5 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,395 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
